suggested.title: Become familiar with COE concepts.
Define, document and share a common COE vocabulary.
Identify and establish a COE lead.
Start building a core virtual COE team made up of the most senior solution architects.
Consider creating a community e-mail alias to begin sharing content.

resources.title: Read Practice Building Through a COE-BUILDING A COE: THE WHAT, WHY & HOW
How to Build More Impactful Centers of Excellence

training.title: Readiness resources are defined as a loose collection

suggested.title: Create an advanced central repository for sharing Azure training material (Sharepoint site, etc.)
Organize training resources using categories, tagging, search, etc.
Begin defining formalized processes for introducing, maintaining and sunsetting Azure training material.
As appropriate, incentivize training through career growth, small bonuses and other rewards.

resources.title: Microsoft Virtual Academy Self-Paced Azure Training

certification.title: Field is mandated to achieve Microsoft Specialist: Architecting Microsoft Azure Solutions

suggested.title: Create a virtual team within the COE dedicated to driving certification.
Continue to build and share central repository of certification resources.
Actively encourage those that have achieved basic certification and MCSA to pursue MCSD.
Encourage healthy competition between groups and regions to drive certification.
Work with marketing to drive public awareness of field certification.
Incentivize specialists to mentor and encourage others to achieve certification.
Ensure that both internal and Microsoft feedback channel information is readily available.
Actively encourage individuals to participate in UserVoice forums.
Create an advanced central tool (Yammer, etc.) for sharing feedback with the COE.
Identify appropriate client solutions/projects and begin participating in SDRs.
Encourage field to make gathering Azure-related feedback part of project reviews where appropriate.

resources.title: Deploying a Successful Enterprise Social Network

roadmap.title: COE reviews existing application portfolio to look for ways to take advantage of future Microsoft offerings

suggested.title: Monitor other Microsoft products and services roadmaps.
Work with Microsoft EPG and PEAT to create a case study around a Lighthouse win.
Work with Microsoft product groups through the Microsoft COE and your CSA to integrate private preview features in a customer solution.
Regularly update offers and solutions against the Azure roadmap.
Regularly update automation assets, best practices and reference architectures against the Azure roadmap.
Work with the Microsoft COE and your CSA to obtain access to internal NDA roadmaps.
Request access to the Azure Advisors private Yammer group.
Communicate with Microsoft product groups through the Microsoft COE and your CSA to get information on upcoming features and services.
Refer to and share free Microsoft resources as a foundation for building a library of best practices.
Review past projects/solutions to identify and harvest best practices.
Establish a central repository for sharing best practices (Sharepoint site, wiki, etc.)
Schedule informal brownbag sessions with field teams to share and discuss best practices.
Ensure that the field is aware of and is actively encouraged to use and contribute to the best practices repository.

resources.title: Best Practices for Developing ARM Templates

reference_architectures.title: COE enhances reference architectures based on forthcoming service capabilities

suggested.title: Continue to build reference architecture repository through research and regular communication with field teams.
Update existing automation assets (scripts, ARM templates, etc.) to reflect reference architecture.
Create a virtual team within the COE dedicated to managing reference architecture.
Encourage field teams to use the reference architecture repository as part of their project reviews.
Work with the Microsoft COE and your CSA to build reference architecture based on your key solution areas and upcoming Azure features and services.
Define and ensure that field teams are aware of the purpose and nature of architecture reviews.
Refer to free Microsoft resources for guidance on running effective architecture reviews.
Take advantage of partner advisory hours through your MPN subscription to support architecture reviews.
Conduct practice architecture reviews on past projects/solutions.
Mandate that some form of architecture review is required at the beginning of all projects.
Encourage field teams to "cross-pollinate" where possible and observe architecture reviews from other projects/teams.

resources.title: Guidelines for Design and Code Reviews
Software Estimation: Demystifying the Black Art

support.title: Escalation process is well-defined and discoverable with COE participation to harvest best practices and update automation tools

suggested.title: Continue to review and update support materials and processes based on Azure roadmap and field feedback.
Establish and publish support SLAs.
Encourage field teams to submit support content for review.
Automate the collection of field feedback to help continuously improve support materials and processes.

resources.title: Build your SLA with these five points in mind
10 Best Practices to Improve Customer Support
13 Ways to Develop Your Company's Help Desk Best Practices

technical_presales.title: COE participates in joint customer engagements to help land initial offers and mentor senior field members

suggested.title: Consider expanding the COE to include pre-sales roles.
Continue to update pre-sales best practices repository based on Azure roadmap and regular collaboration with pre-sales team.
Continue to create and update sales readiness materials based on Azure roadmap and regular collaboration with pre-sales team.
Encourage open communication between pre-sales and COE through internal social channels (Yammer, etc.)

resources.title: Deploying a Successful Enterprise Social Network

wins.title: Wins are documented in a centralized repository and easily discoverable through search and tagging and provide reference architecture diagrams

suggested.title: Use tools such as Excel and PowerBI to help identify common win factors, adjust target metrics (consumption, etc.) and make other delivery changes.
Establish a cadence for identifying and including new wins prominently in the repository and archiving older wins.
Continue to regularly update best practices and reference architecture repository based on experiences from wins.
When appropriate, incentivize wins through career growth, small bonuses and other rewards.

solution_areas.title: One or more defined solution areas

suggested.title: Expand and continue to define solution areas by associating best practices, reference architectures and wins.
Work with business development, marketing, sales and field teams to create and share solution area readiness materials.
Create a central, searchable repository for sharing solution area readiness materials (Sharepoint site, VSTS/Github repository, etc.)
Work with business development, marketing and sales teams to ensure that efforts are aligned with solution areas.

lighthouse_wins.title: Five or more wins the COE considers Lighthouse

suggested.title: Collaborate regularly with business development, sales and field teams to identify potential Lighthouse wins.
Create a virtual team within the COE dedicated to identifying and sharing Lighthouse wins.
Expand Lighthouse wins to specific verticals.

feedback.title: No capture of missed opportunities or customer objections

suggested.title: Encourage sales teams to record missed opportunities using existing sales pipeline tools.
Enagage with sales teams to understand top missed opportunity "pain points".
Engage with customers directly to understand why they decided to not accept offers.

resources.title: How to set up a Sales Tracking Process
